title: Suspect in quadruple shooting in Parramore arrested
content:
ORLANDO, Fla. —
Orlando police have made an arrest after the shooting of four people in a store robbery Saturday night.
Authorities said Roy Stephens, 34, was taken into custody at a hospital and will be taken to jail when his medical condition permits.
Stephens faces numerous charges, including four counts of attempted first-degree murder and armed robbery.
Investigators said Stephens entered the Tip-Top Grocery on South Parramore Avenue at 9 p.m. Saturday and shot four people.
Witnesses called 911 and provided a description of the getaway vehicle.
Police found the vehicle at Lee Avenue and Long Street, and Stephens was arrested after his vehicle was rammed by a police cruiser.
Officials said three of the victims are in stable condition and one was in critical condition. The victims' names were not immediately released.
A police K-9 unit was injured in the arrest but is expected to recover.
Records showed Stephens served two terms in the Florida Department of Corrections for identity fraud in the 1990s and armed robbery in 2010. He also has several convictions in Orange County.
